t: And*p I said, Hear, I pray you, O heads of Jacob, and ye princes of the house of Israel; Is it not for you to know judgment?
Who*p hate the good, and love the evil; who pluck off their skin from off them, and their flesh from off their bones;
Who*p also eat the flesh of my people, and flay their skin from off them; and they break their bones, and chop them in pieces, as for the pot, and as flesh within the caldron.
Then*p shall they cry unto the Lord,*s but he will not hear them: he will even hide his face from them at that time, as they have behaved themselves ill in their doings.
Thus*p saith the Lord*s concerning the prophets that make my people err, that bite with their teeth, and cry, Peace; and he that putteth not into their mouths, they even prepare war against him.

Therefore*p night shall be unto you, that ye shall not have a vision; and it shall be dark unto you, that ye shall not divine; and the sun shall go down over the prophets, and the day shall be dark over them.
Then*p shall the seers be ashamed, and the diviners confounded: yea, they shall all cover their lips; for there is no answer of God.
But*p truly I am full of power by the spirit of the Lord,*s and of judgment, and of might, to declare unto Jacob his transgression, and to Israel his sin.
Hear*p this, I pray you, ye heads of the house of Jacob, and princes of the house of Israel, that abhor judgment, and pervert all equity.
They*p build up Zion with blood, and Jerusalem with iniquity.

The*p heads thereof judge for reward, and the priests thereof teach for hire, and the prophets thereof divine for money: yet will they lean upon the Lord,*s and say, Is not the Lord*s among us? none evil can come upon us.
Therefore*p shall Zion for your sake be plowed as a field, and Jerusalem shall become heaps, and the mountain of the house as the high places of the forest.
